item.title: Open-World Games That Are Still Hard To Live Up To
item.description:
The open-world genre has seen a lot of advancement in the past few years. New technologies and developer tools like the Unreal Engine 5 have made developing an open-world game more accessible than ever before. Despite these advances, however, there are a handful of open-world titles that have remained virtually untouchable over time, proving time and again that surpassing them isn't a simple matter.

All open-world games that come after them use them as a benchmark for excellence, taking note of how life was breathed into those open worlds, and trying to recapture the same magic once more.

Red Dead Redemption 2

A Masterclass in Crafting Life Into an Open World

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
175
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Rockstar has a long track record of making era-defining games over the years, and perhaps the best example of this is Red Dead Redemption 2 , the highly anticipated sequel to the beloved RDR that exceeded even the most optimistic predictions about the game. The game offers an unparalleled level of detail and realism, with a living, breathing world that reacts to player choices in a way that somehow doesn't feel scripted.

Immersion is Red Dead Redemption 2 's core focus. The characters feel real, not simply because they have great dialogue or react to the player organically, but because of their mannerisms. From the smallest rodent caught underfoot to random NPCs on the street, everything moves naturally. The attention to detail for these minute mannerisms makes the game world feel alive in a way that few other games have managed to achieve.

Cyberpunk 2077

The Benchmark for Sci-Fi World-Building in Games

Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
124
8.9 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

The world-building of Night City is Cyberpunk 2077 's crowning achievement, and something that elevates it from a good game to a great one. The sci-fi setting is quite uncommon in the open-world genre, which means that for players looking for something to scratch this particular itch, nothing else comes close.

It is a visually stunning game dripping with character, filled with believable NPCs that feel like they're alive and not merely existing for the benefit of the player. Gameplay has depth and variety, allowing players to pick and choose different playstyles depending on their preference. Combined, these elements not only make Cyberpunk 2077 the complete package, but the gold standard in the open-world sci-fi genre.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

The Gold Standard for Storytelling in Open Worlds

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
56
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Based on the books by Andrzej Sapkowski, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt tells the story of Geralt of Rivia, the White Wolf, as he roams the land as a monster-slayer-for-hire, going from town to town, taking up contracts to kill monsters. The open world is a dense, lovingly hand-crafted map filled with secrets, treasures, and surprises. Combat is addictive and action-packed, with deep customization, build variety, and tons of weapon choices for Geralt.

Surprisingly, the most interesting thing about The Witcher 3 's story isn't the griffins that fly overhead, the vampires that hunt the living, or even the magic system, but the ugliness of human nature presented in all its grotesque glory. Geralt's adventure is grim, gritty, and oftentimes tragic, and it's all the more compelling for it. In terms of narrative storytelling that players will remember years after they've put down the game for good, The Witcher 3 has few equals.

Grand Theft Auto 5

A Decade-Defining Open World That Refuses to Fade

Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
152
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Released back in 2013, Grand Theft Auto 5 is still considered among the most impressive open-world games ever made. The sprawling, satirical recreation of Los Angeles feels authentic, as if made to scale. Characters walk and talk like real people, and not just the ones that the player controls or heavily interacts with, but even random NPCs on the street feel like they're going about their lives in the big city.

As if that wasn't enough, the introduction of GTA Online added an unprecedented layer of realism to Los Santos. Now, multiple real players can inhabit the same city, take up jobs as cab drivers or burger flippers, join bank heists, or patrol the streets as police officers. The cultural impact and longevity of GTA 5 is not something that has been seen before, even among previous games in the franchise.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

The Most Influential Fantasy Realm Ever Crafted

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
82
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

There are few open-world games more influential than Bethesda's The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim , considered by many to be the most successful game in the entire Elder Scrolls franchise. What makes Skyrim hard to live up to, however, isn't just the game itself, but the highly active modding community that has dedicated itself to it.

While the base Skyrim game is certainly impressive for a 2011 title, it would have been long forgotten by now by a vast majority of gamers if not for the hundreds of thousands of Skyrim mods that allow players to keep reinventing the single-player experience in endlessly diverse ways.

Elden Ring

The Open World That Redefined Challenge and Discovery

Elden Ring
10 /10
70
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Elden Ring is FromSoftware's very first fully open-world Soulsborne game, and despite being released in 2022, the game essentially has no competitors in the space that even come close to it. The combination of the slow-paced and punishing combat from Dark Souls and an absolutely massive world filled with secrets is something that hasn't been replicated with any sort of success following Elden Ring , and that might very well remain true for years to come.

Many were skeptical about Elden Ring 's concept prior to its release, as open-world and Soulslike seemed like contradictory genres to pair up in a single game, but FromSoftware proved that it could be done, and done well. Cryptic, confusing, and oftentimes frustrating, Elden Ring set a new gold standard for open-world exploration and combat with its release, and future titles have a tall bar to clear in order to surpass it.

Outer Wilds

A Universe of Secrets Waiting to Be Discovered

Outer Wilds
9.2 /10
Released
May 28, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Outer Wilds is an indie game that redefines what the term "open-world" means. Players explore a compact solar system in a spaceship, discovering secrets, solving puzzles, and uncovering mysteries along the way. The game rewards curiosity and critical thinking above all else, and doesn't hold the player's hand, especially when solving puzzles.

It's hard to describe Outer Wilds without ruining the experience for someone who hasn't played it, but suffice it to say that it makes clever use of time loops to deliver a narrative with immense emotional impact. There is nothing else quite like it in the gaming industry, and that is not a statement players hear every day.

Subnautica

An Underwater World Filled With Wonder and Terror

Subnautica
13
9.2 /10
Released
January 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Open-world games live and die by the quality of their exploration, and few game worlds come close to the majesty and wonder of Subnautica 's underwater expanse. Exploring the ocean for the first time feels like discovering a whole new world, and the sense of wonder and awe only grows as players dive deeper in.

There are no NPCs in Subnautica ; it's just the player, the ocean, and the creatures that call the sea home. The solitary experience is sobering and cathartic in equal measure, and since the survival mechanics force players to slow down and take in the game world one section at a time, exploration is mandatory. Few open-world games tackle underwater exploration, meaning Subnautica stands mostly alone in its sub-genre. The only title that manages to come closest to it is Breathedge , often called " Subnautica in Space" by fans, but even that doesn't top the original.

item.title: All Little Caesars x Black Ops 7 Rewards
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is almost here, taking players into the year 2035 when the game launches on November 14. Players jumping in can dive into a co-op Campaign, compete in high-octane Multiplayer action, and even try their luck at battling the undead in the games launch Zombies map, Ashes of the Damned.

Theres a ton to get into when Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 rolls around, with a long grind and plenty of progression ahead. However, fans who enjoy grabbing a bite from Little Caesars can also score themselves a bunch of unique rewards. The popular restaurant chain has once again teamed up with Call of Duty to celebrate the games launch. Heres how to get all the rewards available as part of the Little Caesars x Black Ops 7 promotion.

How to Unlock Little Caesars x Black Ops 7 Rewards

Before players can start unlocking the Little Caesars x Black Ops 7 rewards, they must first link their Activision and Little Caesars accounts. To do this, follow these steps:

  1. Head to the Call of Duty x Little Caesars page.
  2. Select Unlock Rewards.
  3. Log in to your Activision account.
  4. Click Authorize.
  5. Follow the on-screen instructions and sign in to your Little Caesars account to link the two.

From there, players will be directed to the page where they can redeem their codes. Codes are received on the receipts from purchases of $3 or more at Little Caesars , either digitally through their website/app or in-store. These codes can then be entered to unlock free rewards for Black Ops 7 and will also automatically enter players into a sweepstake for a chance to earn additional rewards.

This promotion is only available to residents of the United States, Canada (excluding Quebec), and Mexico.

All Little Caesars x Black Ops 7 Rewards

Little Caesars x Black Ops 7 Code Redemption Rewards

  • 1 Hour Double XP Token
  • Calling Card + 30 Minute Double XP Token
  • Charm + 30 Minute Double XP Token
  • Emblem + 30 Minute Double XP Token
  • Operator Skin + 30 Minute Double XP Token (Guaranteed when 4 Codes are redeemed)
  • 30 Minute Double XP Token (for repeated rewards)

Little Caesars x Black Ops 7 Sweepstakes Rewards

  • Battle Pass + 15 Minute Double XP Token
  • 500 COD Points + 15 Minute Double XP Token
  • 1,100 COD Points + 15 Minute Double XP Token
  • 2,400 COD Points + 15 Minute Double XP Token
  • 13,000 COD Points + 15 Minute Double XP Token
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

item.title: Destiny 2 Renegades Reveals 'Star Wars' Inspired Exotic Weapons and Gear
item.description:
Bungie gives Destiny 2 fans their first look at the new exotic weapons and armor coming in the Renegades expansion. As expected, most of the Destiny 2 gear on display is Bungie's take on classic Star Wars weapons.

It's well known that Destiny 2 isn't doing so well at the moment, with the game's Steam numbers decreasing to dangerous levels for a live service title. Even longtime community members like Datto and Gladd have even stepped away, opting to take a break from the game. However, there remains hope that the Renegades expansion, due out in December, can rekindle the excitement that has seemingly been lost with players.

Destiny 2 Renegades Exotic Weapons and Armor

Narrated by the NPC Spider, the Destiny 2 Renegades trailer kicks off its reveals with new Star Wars -inspired weapons players will be able to obtain. Uncivil Discourse is clearly inspired by Han Solo's DL-44 pistol, while the A499 heavy sniper rifle looks a lot like The Mandalorian 's Amban rifle. In addition, Bungie showed the Modified B-7 Pistol, All or Nothing Pulse Rifle, Compact Defender sidearm and the M-17 Fast Talker SMG.

The Praxic Sword is a kinetic-based weapon, clearly inspired by the Lightsaber from the Star Wars franchise. The Heirloom, a crossbow-shaped weapon that fires high-powered explosive bolts, also appears to be based on Chewbacca's Boltcaster.

In terms of armor, the trailer also gave fans a good look at the exotic armor coming for Hunters, Warlocks, and Titans. First up is the Fortune's Favor leg armor for Hunters, which recharges the shield over time into an overshield. Warlocks get the Deimosuffusion, which suspends enemies near the player and causes damage over time. For most players, these two exotics seem to be a little underwhelming as they either feature mechanics that are already in the game or aren't the flashest. Many hope that there's another layer to discover for each once the Destiny 2 Renegades expansion launches.

Finally, and the item that seems to be generating the most attention, is the Titan's Praxic Vestment. The exotic gear gives Titan players an advanced tactical air move, which many have likened to Anthem 's Javelin flight suits. However, some have made the connection that the Praxic Vestment is Bungie's new take on the highly requested Destiny exotic known as Twilight Garrison. Instead of adding it back as is, Bungie has seemingly tweaked it to become something potentially better.

53
7.7 /10

item.title: PUBG: Battlegrounds PS5 Version is Worse Than Xbox Version
item.description:
PUBG: Battlegrounds will run at a higher resolution on Xbox Series X than on PlayStation 5 . As the battle royale nears a decade old, it's moving away from last-gen consoles, and that shift may come with a surprise for Sony fans. While PUBG on PlayStation 5 will certainly run better than the PS4 version, it'll fall short of the new Xbox version.

On November 13, 2025, PUBG: Battlegrounds will lose PS4 and Xbox One support, but revamped console versions are coming to current-gen systems the same day. PUBG Studios hopes the shift will help keep the game performing to modern standards and will free up resources for further optimizations. While all that might sound great, not everyone will experience the same benefits from the transition.

PUBG: Battlegrounds' PS5 Resolution is Lower Than Xbox Series X

An announcement from PUBG Studios detailed the upcoming current-gen console versions, confirming that PUBG: Battlegrounds will reach 60fps at 1440p on PS5, compared to 60fps at 2160p on the Xbox Series X. While the Xbox Series X is slightly more powerful than the PS5, thanks to marginally higher CPU clock speed and more compute units, it's not often that gamers see a difference that dramatic in Xbox's favor. Sony fans will need the more expensive PS5 Pro to match the Series X's performance for PUBG , although the vanilla PS5 will still outperform the Series S, which can only reach 60fps at 1080p.

PUBG: Battlegrounds Current-Gen Console Performance Compared

Xbox Series S

Xbox Series X

PlayStation 5

PlayStation 5 Pro

Resolution

1080p/1440p

2160p

1440p

2160p

FPS

60fps/30fps

60fps

60fps

60fps

Lower resolution isn't the only edge Xbox has over PlayStation in the new PUBG ports. Current players will be able to keep their earned achievements when moving from Xbox One to Series X or S, but trophies will not transfer between the PS4 and PS5. This isn't the first time PlayStation fans have run into the issue, as Cyberpunk 2077 PS4 trophies didn't carry over to PS5, and the same thing happened with Skyrim: Anniversary Edition before that. According to PUBG Studios, the transfer would be too technically complex to implement because of all the data involved.

PlayStation Plus subscribers do get an exclusive item, the Pixel Art Parachute from PUBG 's initial PlayStation launch, which is not available to Xbox Game Pass users. Regardless, it's an interesting time for the game as it makes improvements for more modern hardware. It will be interesting to see what new updates and improvements come with the shift to current-gen consoles, so PUBG players should keep their eyes peeled in late 2025 and beyond.

23
7.1 /10

PUBG: Battlegrounds

Fight to be the last player standing in an action-packed battle royale. Parachute into a treacherous battleground with only your wits for protection, as you loot gear and outsmart your enemies in a fierce battle royale. Build the ultimate soldier from scratch and test your mettle against up to 99 other players across three unique maps. Only one life. Only one shot at victory per match. Wreak havoc on your own or take on the challenge in a squad of up to four players to increase your chances of survival - and glory. Squad up and join the Battlegrounds for free and experience the original battle royale.

item.title: New Steam Game is Like The Legend of Zelda Meets Octopath Traveler
item.description:
Blending the familiar gameplay mechanics of The Legend of Zelda franchise with the stunning HD-2D pixelated visuals of Octopath Traveler , The Ballad of Bellum transports players to a picturesque world where they must gather strange artifacts to save their friend and become a hero. Early comparisons to the likes of The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening and the upcoming Octopather Traveler 0 are certainly apt, yet The Ballad of Bellum manages to set itself apart from its spiritual predecessors with several unique twists.

A number of games inspired by The Legend of Zelda have caught the attention of action-adventure fans over the years, with many blending nostalgic elements with refreshing stories to create brand-new experiences that hearken back to the golden age of retro console titles. In a similar vein, The Ballad of Bellum brings old-school vibes, not only for its similarities to Zelda but with its striking aesthetic style that evokes the same quaint vibe of Octopath Traveler and other HD-2D video games.

The Ballad of Bellum Trailer Showcases Zelda Gameplay with Octopath Visuals

The Ballad of Bellum is a pixelated action-adventure game that sees players taking on the role of a young adventurer who must gather a number of secret artifacts in order to save their dear friend and, perhaps, the world. Players will be able to explore a vast map, as they journey from the grand port city in the West to a dangerous desert in the East, then onward to a snow-covered mountain in the North and traversing through the deep, dangerous forests in the South. Hidden dungeons will hold unique items and the coveted artifacts, though surprise obstacles, challenging puzzles, and fierce foes will block the way. Players will need to strategize their attacks and perform close-quarters combat to overcome the challenges ahead and save their friend. The free demo of The Ballad of Bellum is available now exclusively for PC via Steam.

Some of the more unique elements of The Ballad of Bellum that set it apart from other video games like Zelda include a full dynamic day and night cycle with changing weather mechanics and character customization with a range of clothing options. While the central story of The Ballad of Bellum may seem insignificant at first, players will experience an unexpected evolution in the game's storytelling as they progress. From traveling across the world in a steam locomotive to gathering the artifacts in the hope of becoming a hero, plenty of secrets lie in store in the vibrant world of The Ballad of Bellum .

As audiences gear up for the launch of Octopath Traveler 0 and others keep their fingers crossed for another new game in the Legend of Zelda franchise, The Ballad of Bellum may be just what fans are looking for with its nostalgic gameplay and eye-catching graphics. Interested players can stay tuned for any updates on an official release date for The Ballad of Bellum and news on upcoming games like The Legend of Zelda , Octopath Traveler , and other beloved adventure titles.

Octopath Traveler 0
